name: Wunderbar Beach Club Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful holiday at the Wunderbar! It is a small hotel with an excellent restaurant. Our room was spacious, immaculate and there was always a mosquito coil on our deck each night. Since there was no tv in our room, we were very pleased with the excellent reading lights both by the bed and on the deck. The staff were terrific! We enjoyed lovely breakfasts and dinners on the halfboard plan. We like our food spicy and the cook responded with lovely seafood, fish, curries...even Sri Lankan style breakfasts for us. We are English Canadians but most of the other guests were German speaking . The staff speak excellent English and are very helpful and low key. This hotel has a turtle project hatching and protecting baby turtles for release...a very eco-friendly spot!
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't say enough good things about the hotel and the staff.
reviews.title: Loved the Turtles

reviews.text: This was the most relaxing holiday ever!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Good Hotel but Overpriced

reviews.text: Would recomend going to see the elephants any trips you want the guys will sort for you.
reviews.title: Great, relaxing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chan you have a fantastic hotel and great people working for you don't change a thing.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Wunderbar

reviews.text: We recently stayed here for 8 nights over Easter / Sri Lankan New Year. We had 3 luxury rooms and each one was lovely - spacious clean and cool. They had lovely balconies which overlooked the pool area. Each evening our cleaner would bring us a mozzie coil so we could sit out and enjoy the view. He was very friendly and ensured we had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Heaven!

reviews.text: The pool is smallish but it is never busy so we found it a peaceful haven to relax during the day (I dont swim in the sea).
reviews.title: Relax & Chill out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is great, perhaps a little more expensive than other places, but each meal we had was delicious and we did notice alot of people coming to Wunderbar purely for the food. The waiters are all fab and made our evenings enjoyable. They take it upon themselves to familiarise themselves with their guests making you feel really at home.
reviews.title: retreat by the ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the other staff were great too, from ensuring that you had a mattress for your sun lounger to ensuring you could get to where you wanted to visit with no problems at all. At night they would often sit and play bongos and invited us to join them, which was really nice.
reviews.title: Avoid!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a little 1 minute walk to the beach, across a rail track - this was of no inconvenience at all as trains are not that regular at all. The beach was lovely, clean and empty!
reviews.title: A wonderful time at wunderbar

reviews.text: We booked the hotel based purley on all the positive comment on Trip Advisor and we're honestly not dissapointed, from pick up from and drop off back at the airport, nothing felt like it was too much trouble, Chan and his team are courteous and offer a first class service that would outstrip anything the Taj up the beach has to offer at a fraction of the price. Rooms are big 35sq meters at a guess and are bright, light and airey.
reviews.title: Tucked away from the hustle and bustle
brilliant
reviews.text: Superb stay apart from the blasted mosquitos I don't know if its the time of year but they are an absolute distraction from dusk onwards, take deet based products and and anything else you can find to try to combat them!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also take enough sun protection cream as decent products are tough to come by locally if you run out.
reviews.title: wonderful wunderbar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel does have free internet, but if you are looking for WIFI go to the cafeteria which is along the main road; (right out the gate away fron Bentota) its about 200 meters on the right.
reviews.title: Laidback in Bentota

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Wunderbar (not German) for Christmas and was brilliant. All the staff,very friendly and athletic guys were so friendly and laid back. This is what was outstanding about this hotel, it felt small and intimate but was professional as a large hotel. The pool was lovely,very clean and always a sunbed and towel for you. The rooms are large,very clean and great balconies. The beach is a short walk over railway track,sounds awful but actually is quite refreshing to see go past (occasionally) down through palm trees.
reviews.title: Little gem of a hotel

likes.liked: — Personal touches. e.g. asked for coffee in the room.. No charge. Great dining. Beautiful location

reviews.text: The Wunderbar was recommended to me by my brother in law who had stayed here 4 times before, he knew that the place would meet up to my high expectations and it most certainly did. I spent 11 nights at the hotel and was treated to excellent food and a service in which nothing was too much trouble for the staff and each request was carried out promptly and with a smile.
reviews.title: Wunderbar is an idyllic place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner, Chan, is a very welcoming man who acts to ensure your whole stay is catered for no matter what your desires are. The beach is literally a stones throw from the restaurant deck and the sound of the Indian Ocean provides a lulling backdrop to the location as a whole. The rooms are simple, I was in a standard, yet comprehensively equipped room, there is a television but you won't need it! In short, I have had a fantastic time here where I haven't had to lift a finger and I have been able to completely relax...Thanks to Chan and the boys.
reviews.title: Wonderful time at the Wunderbar Beach Club

likes.liked: — The friendly staff, value for what you get, great seafood!
likes.disliked: — Bedding/sheets could have been better, lack of TV options/control

reviews.text: Despite a couple of the reviews below, my girlfriend and I booked the Wunderbar for a quick 3 night getaway away from India where we're both expats on assignment. Honestly, I wasn't too turned off by the two negative reviews below because every other review and message board comment I read seemed to say the complete oppostite...that the Wunderbar is great. I'm happy to say it is!
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

likes.liked: — Mixture of professionalism and individual care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booking was done via emailing the property owner (Chan) directly and he was very responsive to my reservation request and follow-up questions. Our flight from Hyderabad to Columbo was 6 (yes 6) hours late but our driver was cheerfully waiting for us at the airport and 3 hours later (around 9:30 PM) we arrived at the hotel. Despite our late arrival, Chan made sure the kitchen stayed open so we could have a late dinner. He even took us to our room without a formal check-in because he could tell we were exhausted. The room (Deluxe room...overlooking pool) was great...especially considering the price. Huge modern bathroom, high ceilings, ocean views on our huge balcony...everything one could expect. The next morning we finally had a look around and could not have been happier. The new restaurant pavillion is very nice and also gives diners ocean views. The food we had was very, very good...especially the seafood (try the lobster and tiger prawns!). The wait/kitchen staff was great about taking into account any special requests and could not have been any friendlier. We spent most of the day at the beach where the Wunderbar staff kept an eye out for our beverage needs and one of the guys even climbed a 50 foot palm tree to get a coconut for my girlfriend for fresh coconut water. There are body/boogie board to rent if you want to catch a wave as well.
reviews.title: Not Wunderbar at all!!

reviews.text: The only small compaints I might have would be perhaps a bit more water pressure in the shower, maybe better quality bedding, more channels and control over the TV...and the ability to order lunch at the beach would have been nice.
reviews.title: Not so wunderbar

description: Wunderbar Beach Club serves you with 14 rooms and 1 bungalow. Our rooms are furnished in accordance to the European standards with a Sri Lankan touch of elegance. All rooms are fitted with king sized beds, en suite bathrooms, air conditioner and ceiling fans. The hotel has a swimming pool and direct access to the sea. We take great pleasure when requested in organising birthday parties, moonlight parties and weddings. There are also have regular special BBQ beach parties with live music where everybody is welcome.
